intro: Pyranthus tullearensis, commonly known as the Tullear pyranthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It produces small, clustered bulbs that store nutrients, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
